articles.title: Truist Reaffirms Buy on NVIDIA (NVDA), Raises PT to $275 on AI Infrastructure Upside
articles.mainIdea: Truist Reaffirms Buy on NVIDIA (NVDA), Raises PT to $275 on AI Infrastructure Upside
articles.summary: Insider Monkey: Truist Reaffirms Buy on NVIDIA (NVDA), Raises PT to $275 on AI Infrastructure Upside. NVIDIA Corporation (NASDAQ:NVDA) is one of the AI Stocks in the Spotlight for Investors. On December 19, Truist reiterated the stock at “Buy” and raised its price target to $275 per share from $255. The firm revised price targets in the semiconductor and artificial intelligence group after establishing 2027 projections. “In this construct, we favor […] Related tickers mentioned: AMD, AVGO, TFC, TTMI.

articles.title: Analysis-Global investors turn to Chinese AI as Wall Street fears bubble
articles.mainIdea: Analysis-Global investors turn to Chinese AI as Wall Street fears bubble
articles.summary: Reuters: Analysis-Global investors turn to Chinese AI as Wall Street fears bubble. Foreigners see China closing ‌the tech gap with the U.S. as Beijing steps up support for AI chipmakers, spurring bets on Chinese companies just as worries grow over lofty valuations on U.S.-listed AI stocks. U.K.-based asset manager Ruffer, for example, said it has "deliberately limited ‌exposure" to the Magnificent Seven - the U.S. tech giants - and is looking to add positions in Alibaba for a bigger exposure to China's AI theme. "While the U.S. remains the leader in frontier AI, China is rapidly narrowing the gap," said Gemma Cairns-Smith, Investment Specialist at Ruffer. Related tickers mentioned: 0981.HK, 5310.TWO, 688008.SS, 688256.SS, 688795.SS, AAPL, AMD, BABA, BIDU, GOOG, META, OPAI.PVT, TCEHY, TSLA, ^IXIC.

articles.title: If You'd Invested $10,000 in Nvidia 10 Years Ago, Here's How Much You'd Have Today
articles.mainIdea: If You'd Invested $10,000 in Nvidia 10 Years Ago, Here's How Much You'd Have Today
articles.summary: Motley Fool: If You'd Invested $10,000 in Nvidia 10 Years Ago, Here's How Much You'd Have Today. Taking a buy-and-hold approach to the chipmaker's stock could have made you a multimillionaire.
